casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Clegon ROSE. No. 300P06. Supreme Court of North Carolina. January 25, 2007. Lisa Miles, for Clegon Rose. J. Allen Jernigan, Special Deputy Attorney General, L. Johnson Britt, III, District Attorney, for State of NC.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the notice of appeal from the North Carolina Court of Appeals, filed by the Defendant on the 6th day of June 2006 in this matter pursuant to G.S. 7A-30, and the motion to dismiss the appeal for lack of substantial constitutional question filed by the Attorney General, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals: the motion to dismiss the appeal is

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 25th day of January 2007."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 6th day of June 2006 by Defendant in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 25th day of January 2007."
